meanings.definition: A carbanion is a chemical species with a negatively charged carbon atom.
meanings.sent1: In organic chemistry, carbanions play a crucial role in many reactions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of carbanions to understand their reactivity.
meanings.sent3: The carbanions at the party were the life of the chemical reaction!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a carbanion, always ready to spark new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful models to explain the concept of carbanions to the students.

meanings.definition: Carbanions are often formed by the removal of a proton from a carbon atom.
meanings.sent1: When a proton is removed from a carbon atom, carbanions are generated.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the stability of carbanions in different solvents.
meanings.sent3: The carbanions in the lab were mischievously playing with the protons.
meanings.sent4: His boldness was like a carbanion, unafraid to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The student visualized carbanions as tiny charged carbon atoms dancing around.
